New Records: Virat Kohli scored his 48th ODI hundred.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli anchored India's 257-run chase with an unbeaten 103.
India defeated Bangladesh by seven wickets to secure their fourth successive victory in the World Cup.
India, set a target of 257, finished on 261-3 inside 42 overs with Kohli hitting the winning runs with a six off spinner Nasum Ahmed.
Bangladesh openers gained pace and scored 100 runs in 17.2 overs.
Ravindra Jadeja, Mohammed Siraj, and Jasprit Bumrah picked 2 wickets each for India.
Tanzid Hasan scored his maiden ODI half-century in just 41 balls.
Litton Das scored his 12th ODI half-century off 62 balls.
Rohit Sharma scored 48 runs before being caught by Towhid Hridoy.
Shubman Gill reached his 10th ODI fifty.
Mehidy Hasan Miraz took two wickets for Bangladesh.
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh's skipper Shakib-Al-Hasan missed the game, and Najmul Hossain Shanto took over as captain.
Bangladesh won the toss and elected to bat first.
India have a 3-1 record against Bangladesh in World Cups.
In the last four ODIs played between the two teams, Bangladesh have beaten India thrice.
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli gave due respect to Bangladeshi bowlers, stating that there are no big teams in the World Cup and that one must play their best against all bowlers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: India maintained their unbeaten streak in the World Cup with this victory.
Bangladesh's recent track record against India includes three victories in their last four matches.
